member.name: T:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.GaugeContainer
member.summary: GaugeContainer is the root object of Dundas Gauge.
member.remarks:
The gauge container may contain the following:
Circular gauges, stored in the collection.
Linear gauges, stored in the collection.
State indicators, stored in the collection.
Numeric indicators, stored in the collection.
Input values, stored in the collection.
The gauge coordinate system provides the basis for positioning and sizing of all elements contained in the container. The origin is the upper-left corner with the X axis pointing to the right and the Y axis pointing down. Coordinate values are between 0 and 100 percent, and all measurements are represented as a percentage of the parent object's width and height. If a gauge element has a parent object then its coordinate system is relative to its parent, and not the gauge container.
The gauge container exposes the and events, used for custom drawing.
An important property is the collection, which stores objects. Input values can be used as source values for other gauge elements that have a value (e.g. pointers, indicators, etc.) by using their ValueSource property. The advantage to using input values is that their historical data (a history is created that stores previous values) can be used for near-real time playback, as well as calculated values. They also provide a data binding mechanism.
Serialization can be accomplished using the prorpety, which gets a object.

member.name: M:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.GaugeContainer.HitTest(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Call this method to determine the gauge element, if any, that is located at a point defined by given X and Y coordinates.
member.param: The X coordinate for the point in question. Often obtained from a parameter in an event (e.g. the X parameter value in the MouseDown event).
The Y coordinate for the point in question. Often obtained from a parameter in an event (e.g. the Y parameter value in the MouseDown event).
member.returns: A object, which provides information concerning the gauge element (if any) that is at the specified location.
member.remarks: Call this method to determine the gauge element (if any) that is located at a specified point. Often this method is used in some mouse-related event (e.g. MouseDown) to determine what gauge element the end-user clicked on. The X and Y mouse coordinates obtained from the event parameters are then used for the X and Y parameter values of this method call. The returned object's properties can then be used to determine what gauge element was clicked on, and also provides an instance of the actual object selected (if any).

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.GaugeContainer.Images
member.summary: Gets a collection containing gauge images of the control.
member.value: A that contains gauge images in the container.
member.remarks:
The gauge images in this collection can be accessed either by index or by name, and can be displayed anywhere within the container.
A top image can be displayed on top of the container using the property.
Various other gauge elements may also use images (e.g. a pointer can have an image, used as a custom pointer and set via the pointer's Image property).

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.GaugeContainer.Labels
member.summary: Gets a collection containing the labels of the control.
member.value: A object that contains labels of the container.
member.remarks:
The labels in this collection can be accessed either by index or by name, and can be displayed anywhere within the container.
Note that these are not scale labels (a scale has standard and custom labels).

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.GaugeContainer.NamedImages
member.summary: Gets a collection containing all named images in the control.
member.value: A object that contains all named images in the container.
member.remarks:
The named images in this collection can be accessed either by index or by name.
A named image added to the container can be used at any time as the source for any image property of the gauge, and the named image is saved as a resource. NOTE: For the Gauge web control, this functionality is limited due to the limited lifetime of the control.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.GaugeContainer.MapAreas
member.summary: Map area collection, which contains custom map areas.
member.value: A object, that stores elements. objects
member.remarks:
objects represent custom map areas, as opposed to map areas that are automatically created for gauge elements as a result of having their Href or ToolTip property being set.
NOTE: Setting this property will only have an effect if the property is set to true.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.GaugeContainer.RefreshRate
member.summary: Gets or sets the refresh rate of the entire gauge container in redraws per second.
member.value: A double that represents how many times per second the gauge container is to be redrawn. The default value is 30.
member.exception: An ArgumentException will be thrown if the value is less than 0.
member.remarks:
This property determines how many times per second the gauge container should be refreshed. Decreasing this value might improve performance, but the motion of the pointers may become choppy.
This property is only used when the Dundas Gauge for .NET is rendered as a Windows Forms Control.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.GaugeContainer.MapEnabled
member.summary: Determines if client-side image maps are enabled.
member.value: If true client-side image maps will be enabled, if false they will not be. Defaults to true.
member.remarks: If this property is set to false then setting the property, as well as setting the Tooltip and Href properties of gauge elements, will not result in their associated image maps being created.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.GaugeContainer.AutoLayout
member.summary: Determines if the location and size of all circular and linear gauges is to be calculated automatically for the best fit.
member.value: If true the gauge location/sizes are automatically calculated, if false they are not. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.GaugeContainer.DataSource
member.summary: Gets or sets the source containing a list of values used to populate history data.
member.value: A System.Collections.IEnumerable implemented object that contains a collection of values used to supply data to this control. The default value is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
member.remarks: Use the DataSource property to specify the source of values to bind to history data of the control. The data source must be an object that implements the interface (such as , , and ) to bind to history data.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.GaugeContainer.RealTimeDataInterval
member.summary: Determines how often (in seconds) the Windows Forms control will poll the Web server in order to retrieve real-time data. When the server if polled the event is fired. This event must be handled on the server in order to provide the real time data.
member.value: A float representing the time between polls in seconds. The default value is 1, which means that the Windows Forms control will poll the server every second.
member.remarks: Use this property in conjunction with the event in order to provide real time data to the Windows Forms control when it is hosted in a web browser.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.GaugeContainer.ViewStateContent
member.summary: Determines the view state to be persisted on the server.
member.value: A enumeration value that represents the view state. The default value is .
member.remarks: Use this property to set the view state of the GaugeContainer control. When using this property the view state is automatically saved by the GaugeContainer control, and is also loaded automatically when a postback occurs. To enable state management set the EnableViewState property to TRUE.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.GaugeContainer.ImageType
member.summary: Determines the type of image to be rendered. Can be Png, Jpg, Bmp, Flash, etc. When the property is set to RenderType.RealTimeStreaming" this property also determines if the real time streaming will be image based or Flash based.
member.value: An value. Defaults to ImageType.Png.
member.remarks: For Jpg note that the compression can be set using the property.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.GaugeContainer.Compression
member.summary: Image compression value. Ranges from 0 to 100 percent, used for JPEGs.
member.value: An integer that represents the percentage of JPEG compression. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.GaugeContainer.ImageUrl
member.summary: Gauge image's absolute or relative URL, which determines the location where the gauge image is saved. Only used when the image is rendered as an IMG tag or INPUT tag.
member.remarks:
This property has no effect if the property is set to binary streaming.
The temporary image files can be managed by using this ImageUrl property. There are 3 type of file management: Single Filename; Unique Filenames using UIDS; and Round Robin (the default). For more information see the "Image File Management" help topic.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.GaugeContainer.RenderType
member.summary: Determines if the gauge should be rendered as an image tag, input tag, binary data stream or image map.
member.value: A value, that represents the rendering type. Defaults to RenderType.ImageTag.
member.remarks: If rendered as an IMG tag then the URL where the temporary image is saved is determined by the property.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.GaugeContainer.TransparentColor

member.summary: Determines if the gauge should be rendered as a WinForms control.
member.value: A value, that specifies if the control should be rendered as a WinForms contorol. The default value is AutoBool.False.
member.remarks: If this property is set to AutoBool.Auto the control with check if the client has .NET installed and render as a WinForms control. If the client does not have the .NET runtime installed

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.GaugeContainer.LoadingDataText
member.summary: Gets or sets the text message which is displayed while the control's data is being loaded from the server. Applies only when the GaugeContainer is renders as a Windows Forms control hosted in a web browser.
member.value: A string containg the message. The default value is "Loading...".
member.remarks: When the Windows Forms control is first displayed in a web browser it connects to the server in order to load its data. This might take some time, so it is a good idea to display a message indicating to the user that data is being loaded.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.GaugeContainer.LoadingDataImage
member.summary: Gets or sets the location of the image which is displayed while the control's data is being loaded from the server. Applies only when the GaugeContainer is renders as a Windows Forms control hosted in a web browser.
member.value: A string containg location of the image. By default this property is empty.
member.remarks: When the Windows Forms control is first displayed in a web browser it connects to the server in order to load its data. This might take some time, so it is a good idea to display a message or an image (or both) indicating to the user that data is being loaded.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.GaugeContainer.LoadingControlImage
member.summary: Gets or sets the location of the image which is displayed while the control's DLL is being loaded from the server. Applies only when the GaugeContainer is renders as a Windows Forms control hosted in a web browser.
member.value: A string containg location of the image. By default this property is empty.
member.remarks: Before the Windows Forms control is first displayed in a web browser, the browser has to download the control's DLL file from the server. This process sometimes take time, so it is a good idea to display an image to the user.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.GaugeContainer.IsRealTimeDataRequest
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the control is being loaded in response to a real time data request, or if it is being loaded and accessed for the first time.
member.value: The value will be true if this is a real time data request; otherwise false.
member.remarks: When the control is performing real-time data requests, either through SmartClient or RealTimeStreaming, the server will be hit at intervals specified by the property. Use this property in events like to determine if this is a real-time data request or the control is being loaded for the first time.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.GaugeContainer.IsCallback
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this request is an AJAX callback.
member.value: The value will be true if this is a callback request; otherwise false.
member.remarks: When the zooming or panning functionality is enabled the control will receive requests for partial content from the client. In this case only a small section of the content is rendered. In this case this property will be set to True. This property will also be True is this is a rasult from calling doCallback() from JavaScript on the client.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.GaugeContainer.TagAttributes
member.summary: Gets or sets any additional attributes that are to be placed inside the rendered tag.
member.value: A string containg location of the image. By default this property is empty.

remarks.p: If the property is set to RenderType.ImageTag the Dundas Gauge component will place an img tag with the location of the gauge image on the server. You can use the TagAttributes property to place any additional attributes of the img tag, like align, border, alt, etc. You can also use this property to handle events such as onload, onclick, etc."

If the Dundas Gauge is rendered as a Winows Forms control (a.k.a. SmartClient) an object tag is placed. Then the TagAttributes property can be used to provide additional attributes that will be placed inside the object tag. Similarly you can use it to specify attributes and handle events.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.GaugeContainer.SelectionMarkerColor
member.summary: Determines the fill color of the markers of a selected element.
member.value: The default value is Color.LightBlue.
member.remarks: A gauge element can be selected by setting its Selected property to true.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.GaugeContainer.SelectionBorderColor
member.summary: Determines the border color of the selection.
member.value: The default value is Color.Black.
member.remarks: A gauge element can be selected by setting its Selected property to true.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.GaugeContainer.Width
member.summary: Width of the gauge container. Should be UnitType.Pixel.
member.value: A value. Defaults to 320 pixels.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.GaugeContainer.Height
member.summary: Height of the gauge container. Should be UnitType.Pixel.
member.value: A value. Defaults to 240 pixels.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.GaugeContainer.EnableViewState
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value that determines if state management is enabled.
member.value: True if state management is enabled, otherwise false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Setting this property (which is inherited from the Windows Form Control class) to true will enable state management for the GaugeContainer control. The view state that is saved is determined by either the or properties. For further information consult your Visual Studio documentation concerning view state or state mangement.

member.summary: The DefineShape3 tag defines a shape for later use by control tags such as PlaceObject. The ShapeId uniquely identifies this shape as character in the Dictionary. The ShapeBounds field is the rectangle that completely encloses the shape. The SHAPEWITHSTYLE structure includes all the paths, fill styles and line styles that make up the shape

The DefineShape tag defines a shape for later use by control tags such as PlaceObject. The ShapeId uniquely identifies this shape as character in the Dictionary. The ShapeBounds field is the rectangle that completely encloses the shape. The SHAPEWITHSTYLE structure includes all the paths, fill styles and line styles that make up the shape
member.param: True if linear gradient is centered.

member.name: M:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.FlashUtility.WriteLongRecordHeader(Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.BitWriter,Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.FlashUtility.RecordTagType,System.Int32)
member.summary: Each tag begins with a tag type and a length. There are two tag header formats, short and long. Short tag headers are used for tags with 62 bytes of data or less. Long tag headers can be used for any tag size up to 4GB, far larger than is presently practical.

member.name: T:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.InputValue
member.summary: InputValue represents an input value of the gauge container, and has an associated history that stores previous values along with a time stamp.
member.remarks:
These input values are stored in the collection property, and can be used as a value source for pointers, ranges, and indicators via their ValueSource property.
The advantage to using input values is that their historical data can be used for playback, as well as calculated values. They also provide a data binding mechanism.
An input value can be used to perform data binding with external data sources. Data binding is performed at design-time using the , and properties, or can be performed at run-time using the method.
An input value can have one more associated objects, which are stored in the collection property.
The property is that field that has the date of the historical record, and the is that field that has the value of the historical record.

member.name: M:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.InputValue.DataBind
member.summary: Data binds the input value to a data source.
member.remarks:
The DataBind method will bind the input value to the data source specified by the property.
In cases where a data source is set to an input value and no other data operations are required, the DataBind method is not required to be explicitly called. In these cases, the GaugeContainer itself will databind all input values to the data source prior to rendering.

member.name: T:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NamedCollection
member.summary: Base class for most Dundas Gauge collections.
member.remarks:
This is the base class for almost all collections in Dundas Gauge, such as Values, Gauges, Pointers, Scales, Ranges, etc.
The collection stores the base class, NamedElement which is also the base class of Dundas Gauge.
The main purpose of this class is to control names and elements for duplication.

member.param: The value whose element to get.

member.remarks: GetByName compares the specified to the value of the property of each element, and returns the matching element.

member.name: M:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NamedCollection.IndexOf(System.Object)
member.summary: Searches for the specified object and returns the zero-based index of the first occurrence within the entire collection.
member.param: The object to locate in the collection. The value can be a null reference (or Nothing in Visual Basic).
member.returns: The zero-based index of the first occurrence of value within the entire collection, if found; otherwise -1.
member.remarks:
The collection is searched forward starting at the first element and ending at the last element. This method performs a linear search; therefore, the average execution time is proportional to the Count. That is, this method is an O(n) operation, where n is the Count.
This method determines equality by calling Object.Equals.

member.summary: Disposes of the current object.
member.remarks:
Implements IDisposable.
Do not make this method virtual. Also, a derived class should not be able to override this method.

member.name: M:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NamedCollection.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Dispose(bool disposing) executes in two distinct scenarios. If disposing equals true, the method has been called directly or indirectly by a user's code. Managed and unmanaged resources can be disposed. If disposing equals false, the method has been called by the runtime from inside the finalizer and you should not reference other objects. Only unmanaged resources can be disposed.///

member.name: T:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.GaugeLabel
member.summary: Represents a gauge label, which can be displayed anywhere within the gauge container.
member.remarks:
This class is stored in the property of the root class.
These labels can have a parent element, which effects their coordinate system.
Note that there are also custom labels available, which are used by scales (i.e. a different type of label).

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.GaugeLabel.BackGradientEndColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the end color of the label's background gradient.
member.value: A object that represents the end color of the label's back gradient. The default value is Color.Empty.
member.remarks: This property represents end color of the label's back gradient, and is used if the property is a valid gradient. In addition to that it is also used as the hatch foreground color in case a hatch style is selected via the property.

member.name: T:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.GaugeImage
member.summary: Represents a gauge image, stored in the Images collection property of the container.
member.remarks:
These images can be displayed anywhere within the container.
The source of the image is set by the property, which can be a pathname to an image saved to disk, or the name of a object that has been added to the container's collection.

member.name: T:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.CircularScale
member.summary: Scale for CircularGauge objects.
member.remarks:
Circular scales are stored in the property.
objects are assigned to a circular scale, and it is this scale the pointers 'points' to. objects are also assigned to scales.
The radius of circular scales are measured as a percentage of the width or height of their parent (e.g. gauge container).

member.name: T:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.ScaleBase
member.summary: Represents a scale, which graphically represents a set of values.
member.remarks:
Circular and linear scales are associated with and objects, respectively, and exposed via their Scales property.
Scales have values pointed to by pointers, and can also have associated ranges to highlight a range of their values.
Scales have standard labels (that have an interval, etc.) and also have custom labels, which can be positioned anywhere along a scale.

member.summary: Represents the scale's collection of custom labels.

member.summary: The name of the scale.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.ScaleBase.Minimum
member.summary: The start value of the scale.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.ScaleBase.Maximum
member.summary: The end value of the scale.
member.value: A double that represents the maximum (end) value of the scale. Defaults to 100.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.ScaleBase.Multiplier
member.summary: Amount by which the scale's values are multiplied before being displayed.
member.value: A real number that represents the multiplier value. Defaults to 1.
member.remarks: For example, if the property is set to 10, and this Multiplier property is set to 10, the displayed minimum value will be 100.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.ScaleBase.Interval
member.summary: Determines how often the scale's tick marks and labels will be displayed.
member.value: A double that represents the scale's interval. Defaults to Double.NaN (not set).
member.remarks: The interval can also be offset using .

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.ScaleBase.IntervalOffset
member.summary: Determines the amount by which the scale's tick marks and labels will be offset.
member.value: A double that represents the scale's interval offset. Defaults to Double.NaN (not set).
member.remarks: The interval is set using .

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.ScaleBase.ToolTip
member.summary: The tool tip to be displayed when the cursor is over the scale.
member.value: A string that represents the scale's tool tip.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.ScaleBase.Href
member.summary: The Href of the scale.
member.value: A string that represents the Href.
member.remarks: Setting this prorpety will only have an effect if the MapEnabled property is set to true.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.ScaleBase.MapAreaAttributes
member.summary: Other attributes of the scale's map area.
member.value: A string that represents the map area attributes.
member.remarks: Setting this prorpety will only have an effect if the MapEnabled property is set to true.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.ScaleBase.MajorTickMarkInt
member.summary: The major tick marks attributes of this scale.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.ScaleBase.TickMarksOnTop
member.summary: Determines if the scale's tick marks should drawn on top of any pointers associated with the scale.
member.value: If true the tick marks are drawn on top of pointers, if false they are not. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.ScaleBase.Reversed
member.summary: Determines if the direction of the scale is reversed.
member.value: If true the direction is reversed, if false it is not. Defaults to false.
member.remarks: A reversed circular scale will be counter-clockwise. A reversed linear scale will be right-to-left if horizontal, and top-to-bottom if vertical.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.ScaleBase.Logarithmic
member.summary: Determines if the scale is logarithmic.
member.value: If true the scale is logarithmic, if false it is not. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.ScaleBase.LogarithmicBase
member.summary: Determines the base for logarithmic scales.
member.value: A double that represents the logarithmic base. Defaults to 10.
member.remarks: Setting this property only has an effect if the property is set to true.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.ScaleBase.MinimumPin
member.summary: Attributes for the minimum pin of the scale.
member.value: A value, which represents the minimum pin.
member.remarks: The MinimumPin property sets a delimiter on the minimum value that can be input into a scale. If the value of a pointer falls below the minimum pin of the scale, the pointer will stop moving at the minimum pin.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.ScaleBase.MaximumPin
member.summary: Attributes for the maximum pin of the scale.
member.value: A value, which represents the maximum pin.
member.remarks: The MaximumPin property sets a delimiter on the maximum value that can be input into a scale. If the value of a pointer falls above the maximum pin of the scale, the pointer will stop moving at the maximum pin.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.ScaleBase.Visible
member.summary: Determines the visibility of the scale.
member.value: If true the scale is visible, if false it is not. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.ScaleBase.Width
member.summary: The width of the scale bar, measured as a percent.
member.value: A float that represents the width of the scale.
member.remarks:
For circular scales this will be an arched bar and for linear scales it will be a straight bar.
Measured as a percentage of the scale's radius for circular scales, and for linear scales it is measured as a percentage of the associated object's width.
The scale bar width can be 0.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.ScaleBase.BorderColor
member.summary: The color of the scale bar's border.
member.value: A object that represents the bar's border color. Defaults to Color.Black.
member.remarks: Setting this property will only have an effect if the border width is set to a value greater than 0.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.ScaleBase.BorderStyle
member.summary: The line style of the scale bar's border.
member.value: A value that represents the bar's border style. Defaults to GaugeDashStyle.Solid.
member.remarks: Setting this property will only have an effect if the border width is set to a value greater than 0.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.ScaleBase.BorderWidth
member.summary: The width of the scale bar's border, measured in pixels..
member.value: An integer that represents the bar's width. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.ScaleBase.FillColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the fill color of the scale.
member.value: A that represents the fill color. The default value is Color.CornflowerBlue.
member.remarks: This property represents the fill color of the scale. If a gradient is set via the property this color will be used as the start color for the gradient. Furthermore if a hatch style is set via the property this color will be used as the background color for the hatch.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.ScaleBase.FillGradientType
member.summary: The primary fill gradient type of the scale.
member.value: A object that represents the gradient style. The default value is GradientType.None.
member.remarks: If a gradient is specified then the and properties determine the colors used.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.ScaleBase.FillGradientEndColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the end color of the scale's fill gradient.
member.value: A that represents the gradient end color. The default value is Color.White.
member.remarks: This property represents the end color of the scale's fill gradient. It is used if the property has a valid gradient. In addition to that it is also used as the hatch foreground color in case a hatch style is set via the property.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.ScaleBase.FillHatchStyle
member.summary: The primary fill hatch style of the scale.
member.value: A object that represents the hatch style. The default value is GaugeHatchStyle.None.
member.remarks: If hatching is specified then the and properties determine the colors used.

member.name: T:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.StateIndicator
member.summary: Represents a state indicator.
member.remarks:
State indicators are stored in the collection property.
A state indicator has a collection of states that are stored in the collection property. If the value of the state indicator falls within the start and end range of one of these states then that state is considered to be activated. If not the indicator is in its default state.
An activated object has appearance properties, which determine the appearance of its state indicator when that state is activated.

member.value: A object, used for the default state.

member.summary: The color of the state indicator's border when the indicator is in its default state.
member.value: A object that represents the state indicator's border color. Defaults to Color.Black.
member.remarks: Setting this property will only have an effect if the state indicator border width is set to a value greater than 0.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.StateIndicator.BorderStyle
member.summary: The line style of the state indicator's border when the indicator is in its default state.
member.value: A value that represents the state indicator's border style. Defaults to GaugeDashStyle.Solid.
member.remarks: Setting this property will only have an effect if the border width is set to a value greater than 0.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.StateIndicator.BorderWidth
member.summary: The line width of the state indicator's border when the indicator is in its default state. Measured in pixels.
member.value: An integer that represents the line width. Defaults to 0 pixels.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.StateIndicator.FillColor
member.summary: The fill color of the state indicator's border when the indicator is in its default state.
member.value: A color that represents the fill color. The default value is Color.LawnGreen.
member.remarks: This property represents the fill color of the state indicator when the indicator is in its default state. If a gradient is set via the property this color will be used as the start color for the gradient. Furthermore if a hatch style is set via the property this color will be used as the background color for the hatch.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.StateIndicator.FillGradientType
member.summary: The primary fill gradient type of the state indicator when it is in its default state.
member.value: A object that represents the gradient style. The default value is GradientType.Center.
member.remarks: If a gradient is specified then the and properties determine the colors used.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.StateIndicator.FillGradientEndColor
member.summary: The end color of the state indicator when it is in its default state.
member.value: A that represents the gradient end color. The default value is Color.DarkGreen.
member.remarks: This property represents the end color of the fill gradient. It is used if the property has a valid gradient. In addition to that it is also used as the hatch foreground color in case a hatch style is set via the property.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.StateIndicator.FillHatchStyle
member.summary: The primary fill hatch style of the state indicator when it is in its default state.
member.value: A object that represents the hatch style. The default value is GaugeHatchStyle.None.
member.remarks: If hatching is specified then the and properties determine the colors used.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.StateIndicator.Value
member.summary: The value of the state indicator.
member.value: A double that represents the indicator's value.
member.remarks:
A state indicator has a collection of states that are stored in the collection property. If the value of the state indicator falls within the start and end range of one of these states then that state is considered to be activated. If not the indicator is in its default state.
The value of an indicator can also be set using the property, which allows for the display of calculated values, and also results in a history being created.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.StateIndicator.ValueSource
member.summary: Specifies the name of the input or calculated value.
member.remarks:
If ValueSource is used as the value source a history will be created, which can be used for calculated values and playback.
A state indicator has a collection of states that are stored in the collection property. If the value of the state indicator falls within the start and end range of one of these states then that state is considered to be activated. If not the indicator is in its default state.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.StateIndicator.Text
member.summary: The text of the state indicator when it is in its default state.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.StateIndicator.Image
member.summary: The image to be used when the state indicator is in its default state.
member.value: A string that represents the pathname of an image saved to disk, or the name of a named image stored in the collection property.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.StateIndicator.ImageTransColor
member.summary: The transparent color of the state image.
member.value: A object that represents the color that will be displayed as transparent. Defaults to Color.Empty.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.StateIndicator.ImageHueColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the hue color to be applied to the state image.
member.value: A that represents the hue color to be applied to the state image. The default value is Color.Empty.
member.remarks: The hue color is applied to the entire image in order to modify its hue.

member.name: T:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.Range
member.summary: Represents a range, which displays a range of values.
member.remarks:
Circular and linear ranges are associated with and objects, respectively, and exposed via their Ranges property.
Ranges are usually used to highlight some range of values along a scale, and ranges are always associated with a scale.
There are numerous range-related events that can be used for warnings, etc.

member.summary: The distance from the range to the scale, measured as a percent.
member.value: A float that represents the distance from the scale. Default to 10 percent.
member.remarks: This property is measured as a percentage of the linear gauge's width or height.

member.summary: The name of the scale to which this range belongs.
member.value: A string that represents the name of the scale that the range belongs to.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.RangeBase.InRangeTickMarkColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the scale tick marks that occur within the range.
member.value: A that represents the color. The default value is Color.Empty.
member.remarks:
This color affects the fill color of the scale tick marks that are within this range. This property, along with the property, is very useful if you would like to display a range that simply appears as differently colored scale labels and tick marks.
Even if the property of this range is set to false the scale tick marks will change their fill color.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.RangeBase.InRangeLabelColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the scale labels that occur within the range.
member.value: A that represents the color. The default value is Color.Empty.
member.remarks:
This color affects the fill color of the scale labels that are within this range. This property, along with the property, is very useful if you would like to display a range that simply appears as differently colored scale labels and tick marks.
Even if the property of this range is set to false the scale labels will change their fill color.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.RangeBase.InRangeBarPointerColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the fill color of a bar pointer that falls within this range.
member.value: A that represents the color. The default value is Color.Empty.
member.remarks:
This color affects the fill color of a bar pointer that falls within this range. This property only affects the part of the bar pointer that is within the range, not the entire bar pointer.
Even if the property of this range is set to false the bar pointer will still be affected.

member.summary: The end value of the range.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericRange.DecimalColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the decimals when the indicator's value is in range.

member.remarks: This property represents the text color of the digits when the numerical indicator's value is in range.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericRange.InRangeTimeout
member.summary: Determines how long the value needs to stay in the range before triggering the GaugeContainer.PointerRangeTimeOut event.
member.value: A double that represents the amount of time before the time out event is fired. Defaults to 0 seconds.
member.remarks:
The type of timeout is set by the property.
This property is only used when the Dundas Gauge for .NET is rendered as a Windows Forms control.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericRange.InRangeTimeoutType
member.summary: The type of the InRangeTimeout value. GaugeContainer.PointerRangeTimeOut event.
member.value: A object that represents the type of the time out. Defaults to PeriodType.Seconds.
member.remarks:
The timeout is set by the property.
This property is only used when the Dundas Gauge for .NET is rendered as a Windows Forms control.

member.name: T:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.LinearRange
member.summary: Range for LinearGauge objects.

Like pointers, ranges are assigned to an existing scale.

member.summary: The distance from the range to the scale. Measured as a percent of the radius of the circular gauge object that owns the range.
member.value: A real number that represents the distance from the range to the scale. Defaults to 10 percent.

member.name: T:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.CircularPointerType
member.summary: Types of circular pointers, associated with circular gauges.

member.name: F:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.CircularPointerType.Needle
member.summary: The pointer looks like a standard gauge needle, which also contains a needle cap. The needle cap can be made invisible by setting the property to false.There are several properties that only apply to a Needle style. They all have the "Needle" prefix.

member.name: F:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.CircularPointerType.Marker
member.summary: The pointer is a marker. The shape of the marker can be selected using the property. There are several properties that only apply to a Marker style. They all have the "Marker" prefix.

member.name: F:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.CircularPointerType.Bar
member.summary: The pointer is a bar. The bar can either start at 0 or at the beginning of the scale. There are several properties that only apply to a bar style. All have the "Bar" prefix.

member.name: T:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.CalculatedValueIntegral
member.summary: This class represents an integral calculated value.
member.remarks:
A calculated value is owned by an object, which has a collection.
Calculated values use the history of their input values as source data.

member.name: T:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.CalculatedValue
member.summary: A base class, used for the data engine which performs calculations.
member.remarks:
It implements both IValueConsumer and IValueProvider interfaces. In the Object model, this class is stored in the CalculatedValues collection of objects.
A calculated value is owned by an object, which has a collection.
Calculated values use the history of their input values as source data.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.CalculatedValue.RefreshRate
member.summary: The maximum amount of time that can elapse before the calculated value is refreshed.
member.value: A double that represents the refresh rate. Defaults to not set (Double.NaN).
member.remarks:
This property determines how often the calculated values are recalculated. It will only have an effect if its associated InputValue object has not had its value changed for the given refresh rate, at which point recalculation occurs.
If the refresh rate is not set then the calculated value will not be automatically recalculated.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.CalculatedValue.RefreshRateType

member.value: A value.

member.name: T:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator
member.summary: Represents a numeric indicator.
member.remarks:
Numeric indicators are stored in the collection property.
A numeric indicator has a value, which can be displayed via its property or property.
A numeric indicator can have multiple ranges, set by the property. These allow for the usage of range-related events. The and properties also specify a range.

member.summary: Represents a collection of numeric ranges, used for range-related events.
member.value: A object, used to store the indicator's ranges (if any).
member.remarks: The and properties are also used to set a range.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.ParentObject
member.summary: Gets an object reference to the parent object. If there is no valid parent element the result is null.
member.value: A object.

member.summary: Determines the parent element, which affects the indicator's coordinate system.
member.value: A string that represents the name of the parent object, if any.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.ZOrder
member.summary: Determines the Z order of the numeric indicator in the gauge container.
member.value: An integer that represents the Z order.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.ToolTip
member.summary: The tool tip to be displayed when the cursor is over the numeric indicator.
member.value: A string that represents the tool tip.
member.remarks: The user can format the tool tip using #INPUTVALUE, #INPUTVALUE1, etc. The value from the GaugeContainer.Values collection will then be displayed. #INDICATORVALUE can also be used to show the current value of the numeric indicator.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.Href
member.summary: The Href of the numeric indicator.
member.value: A string that represents the Href.
member.remarks: Setting this prorpety will only have an effect if the MapEnabled property is set to true.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.MapAreaAttributes
member.summary: Other attributes of the indicator's map area.
member.value: A string that represents the map area attributes.
member.remarks: Setting this prorpety will only have an effect if the MapEnabled property is set to true.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.Name
member.summary: The name of the numeric indicator.
member.value: String that represents the name of the numeric indicator.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.Style
member.summary: NOTE: This property is obsolete in Dundas Gauge 2.0. IndicatorStyle is supposed to be used instead. Determines the style of the numeric indicator.
member.value: A value that represents the indicator's style. Defaults to NumericIndicatorStyle.Mechanical.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.IndicatorStyle
member.summary: Determines the style of the numeric indicator.
member.value: A value that represents the indicator's style. Defaults to NumericIndicatorStyle.Mechanical.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.Digits
member.summary: The total number of digits that will be shown, including decimals.
member.value: An integer that represents the total number of displayed digits. Defaults to 6.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.Decimals
member.summary: The total number of decimals that will be shown.
member.value: An integer that represents the total number of displayed decimals. Defaults to 1.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.FontUnit
member.summary: Determines if the font size is measured as a percentage of the parent or in units specified by the Font.Unit property.
member.value: A enumeration which determines the font units. Defaults to FontUnit.Percent.
member.remarks: If ResizeMode is set to AutoFit then FontUnit does not determine the size of the font.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.ResizeMode
member.summary: Determines if the font will be automatically resized so that the text will always fit.
member.value: A value, which represents the resize mode. Defaults to ResizeMode.AutoFit.
member.remarks: If ResizeMode is set to None then the and properties determine the size of the text.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.ShadowOffset
member.summary: Determines how far to the right and down the shadow will appear.
member.value: An integer that represents the shadow offset. Defaults to 1 pixel.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.FormatString
member.summary: The format string, which is a standard .NET format string.
member.value: A string, which is used for formatting.
member.remarks:
This also determines how many numbers after the decimals to show.
Refer to the Formatting Types topic in the MSDN for further information.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.ShowDecimalPoint
member.summary: Determines whether or not the decimal point is displayed.
member.value: If true the decimal point is displayed, if false it is not. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.ShowLeadingZeros
member.summary: Determines whether or not leading zeros are displayed.
member.value: If true the leading zeros are displayed, if false they are not. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.RefreshRate
member.summary: Determines how often the indicator is refreshed per second.
member.value: A real number that determines the refresh rate. Defaults to 10 refreshed per second.
member.remarks: This property is only used when the Dundas Gauge for .NET is rendered as a Windows Forms control.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.OffString
member.summary: The string to be displayed if the Value property is Double.NaN.
member.value: A string that is used if Value is Double.NaN (represents 'not set'). Defaults to '-'.
member.remarks: If this string is longer than the value of the property it will be cropped.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.OutOfRangeString
member.summary: The string to be displayed if the Value property is out of range.
member.value: A string that is used if Value is out of range. Defaults to 'Error'.
member.remarks:
The range is determined by the and values, and/or the property.
If this string is longer than the value of the Digits property it will be cropped.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.ShowSign
member.summary: Determines which sign (plus or minus) to display.
member.value: A value, that represents the sign to display.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.Minimum
member.summary: The start value of the numeric indicator, which determines the start of its range.
member.value: An integer that represents the indicator's minimum. Defaults to double.NegativeInfinity.
member.remarks:
The Minimum and Maximum properties determine the indicator's range, which allows for the usage of range-related events.
Extra ranges can also be added using the property.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.Maximum
member.summary: The end value of the numeric indicator, which determines the end of its range.
member.value: An integer that represents the indicator's minimum. Defaults to double.PositiveInfinity.
member.remarks:
The Minimum and Maximum properties determine the indicator's range, which allows for the usage of range-related events.
Extra ranges can also be added using the property.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.Multiplier
member.summary: Amount by which the indicator's value is multiplied before being displayed.
member.value: A real number that represents the multiplier value. Defaults to 1.
member.remarks: For example, if the property is set to 10, and this Multiplier property is set to 10, the displayed value will be 100.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.SnappingEnabled
member.summary: Determines if snapping of the indicator's value to a given interval is enabled.
member.value: If true the numeric indicator will snap to values determined by the property, if false it will not. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.SnappingInterval
member.summary: The interval to use when snapping is enabled.
member.value: An integer that represents the snapping interval.
member.remarks: If set to 0 there will be no snapping.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.DampeningEnabled
member.summary: Determines if the value movement will be dampened.
member.value: If true dampening is enabled, if false it is not. Defaults to false.
member.remarks:
Dampening can be used if the value is being updated very quickly. Seting it to True will slow down the movement of the numeric indicator. If the Minimum and Maximum properties are set to Double.NegativeInfinity and Double.PositiveInfinity respectively, this property will have no effect.
ASP.NET - This property is only used when the Dundas Gauge for .NET is rendered as a Windows Forms control.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.DampeningSweepTime
member.summary: Represents the time it takes (in seconds) to make a full sweep from the minimum to the maximum of the indicator.
member.value: An integer that represents the dampening sweep time. Defaults to 1 second.
member.remarks:
If the Minimum and Maximum properties are set to Double.NegativeInfinity and Double.PositiveInfinity respectively, this property will have no effect.
ASP.NET - This property is only used when the Dundas Gauge for .NET is rendered as a Windows Forms control.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.Location
member.summary: The location of the indicator inside the gauge container. The coordinates are measured as a percentage of the container's width/height.
member.value: A object, which represents the indicator's location inside its container.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.Size
member.summary: The size of the indicator inside the gauge container. The coordinates are measured as a percentage of the container's width/height.
member.value: A object, which represents the indicator's size inside its container.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.Visible
member.summary: Determines the visibility of the numeric indicator.
member.value: If true the indicator is visible, if false it is not. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.Font
member.summary: Specifies the font used for the indicator's digits.
member.value: A object, used for the digit font.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.BorderColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the numeric indicator's border.
member.value: A object that represents the color of the numeric indicator border. The default value is Color.DimGray.
member.remarks:
This property represents the color of the numeric indicator border.
This property will not have any effect if the property is set to 0.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.BorderStyle
member.summary: The line style of the numeric indicator border.
member.value: A value, that represents the line style. Defaults to GaugeDashStyle.Solid.
member.remarks: This property will not have any effect if the property is set to 0.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.BorderWidth
member.summary: The line width of the numeric indicator's border. Measured in pixels.
member.value: An integer that represents the line width. Defaults to 1 pixel.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.SeparatorColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the lines that separate the digits.
member.value: A object that represents the separator color. The default value is Color.DimGray.
member.remarks:
This property represents the color of the lines that separate the digits of the numeric indicator.
This property will not have any effect if the property is set to 0.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.SeparatorWidth
member.summary: The line width of the separator. Measured in percent of the indicator.
member.value: A real number that represents the separator width. The default value is 1 percent.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.BackColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color of the numeric indicator.
member.value: A that represents the back color. The default value is Color.DimGray.
member.remarks:
This property represents the background color.
If a gradient is selected via the property this color will be used as the start color for the gradient.
If a hatch style is selected through the property this color will be used as the background color for the hatch.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.BackGradientType
member.summary: The gradient type of the background.
member.value: A value that determines the gradient type. Defaults to GradientType.None.
member.remarks: Colors used are determined by the and properties.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.BackGradientEndColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the end color of the numeric indicator's back gradient.
member.value: A that represents the gradient end color. The default value is Color.White.
member.remarks: This property represents the end color of the numeric indicator's back gradient. It is used if the property has a valid gradient. In addition to that it is also used as the hatch foreground color in case a hatch style is set via the property.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.BackHatchStyle
member.summary: The hatch style of the background.
member.value: A value that determines the hatching, if any. Defaults to GaugeHatchStyle.None.
member.remarks: Colors used are determined by the and properties.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.DigitColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the digits in the numeric indicator.
member.value: A that represents the digit color. The default value is Color.SteelBlue.
member.remarks: This property represents the text color of the digits, but not the decimals. The decimals can have a different color, which is determined by the property.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.DecimalColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the decimals in the numeric indicator.
member.value: A that represents the the decimal color. The default value is Color.Firebrick.
member.remarks: This property represents the text color of the decimals, but not the normal digits. Please use the property to set the color of the digits.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.LedDimColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the digit's background in the digital indicator.
member.value: A that represents the the digit background color. The default value is Color.Empty.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.Value
member.summary: The current value of the indicator.
member.value: A double that represents the indicator's value.
member.remarks: Alternatively can be used to set the indicator's value.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.ValueSource
member.summary: Specifies the name of an input or calculated value.
member.value: A double that represents the indicator's input or calculated value.
member.remarks: If is used as the value source a history will be created, which is used for calculated values and playback.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.Selected
member.summary: Determines if the numeric indicator visually appears selected.
member.value: If true the numeric indicator appears selected. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.Position
member.summary: This is a wrapper property for location and size.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NumericIndicator.NumberPosition
member.summary: Gets and sets the pointer position. Setting this property cause Refresh in win control.

member.summary: Gets and sets CommonElements. Setting this property cause set of the Common to the internal DataAttributes object.

member.summary: Gets the DataAttributes reference

member.name: T:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.NamedImage
member.summary: An image with a unique name, which is saved as a resource.
member.remarks:
A named image can be used as the source for any image property (as opposed to specifying an image saved to disk).
Named images are stored in the , which is exposed as the property of the root object.
A named image added to the container can be used at any time as the source for any image property of the gauge.
A named image is saved as a resource.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.ValueChangedEventArgs.PlayBackMode
member.summary: Gets the playback mode.
member.value: If true the gauge is in playback mode, if false it is in normal mode.
member.remarks: The gauge can either display the most recently added values, or it can display values recorded and stored in the histories of input values. When historical data is being displayed this is known as Playback mode.

member.name: T:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.CalculatedValueLinear
member.summary: This class represents a linear calculated value.
member.remarks:
This is a linear calculation that takes one value as input, and outputs the results of the following linear equation being applied to it: Calculated Value = Value*Multiplier + Addend.
A calculated value is owned by an object, which has a collection.
Calculated values use the history of their input values as source data.

member.name: M:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.CalculatedValueLinear.CalculateValue(System.Double,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Calculates linear function.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.CalculatedValueLinear.Multiplier
member.summary: Gets or sets the multiplier (m) in the linear formula f(x) = x*m + a.
member.value: A double that represents the multiplier. Defaults to 1.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.CalculatedValueLinear.Adder
member.summary: Gets or sets the addend (a) in the linear formula f(x) = x*m + a.
member.value: A double that represents the addend of the formula. Defaults to 0.

member.summary: This calculation does not use the Period property.

member.summary: This calculation does not use the PeriodType property.

member.summary: This calculation does not use the RefreshRate property.

member.summary: This calculation does not use the RefreshRateType property.

member.name: M:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.GaugeObject.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Dispose(bool disposing) executes in two distinct scenarios. If disposing equals true, the method has been called directly or indirectly by a user's code. Managed and unmanaged resources can be disposed. If disposing equals false, the method has been called by the runtime from inside the finalizer and you should not reference other objects. Only unmanaged resources can be disposed.

member.summary: The color of the tick mark's border.

member.remarks: Setting this property will only have an effect if the tick mark border width is set to a value greater than 0.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.CustomTickMark.BorderWidth
member.summary: The width of the tick mark's border.
member.value: An integer that represents the tick mark's width. Defaults to 1.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.CustomTickMark.FillColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the fill color of the tick mark.
member.value: A that represents the fill color. The default value is Color.WhiteSmoke.
member.remarks: This property represents the fill color of the tick mark. A gradient will only be displayed if the property is set to true

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.CustomTickMark.EnableGradient
member.summary: Determines whether or not a gradient effect is used for the tick mark.
member.value: true if the gradient is enabled, false if it is not. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.CustomTickMark.GradientDensity
member.summary: Determines the density of the gradient effect. Allowable values are between 0 and 100 percent.
member.value: A float that represents the percentage of gradient density.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.CustomTickMark.DistanceFromScale
member.summary: The distance from the tick mark to the scale. Measured as a percent.
member.value: A real number that represents the offset of the tick mark from its normal position. Defaults to 0 percent.
member.remarks: For tick marks for circular scales this is measured as a percent of the radius of the circular scale. For tick marks for linear scales it is measured as a percentage of the associated linear gauge's width or height.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.CustomTickMark.Shape
member.summary: Determines the shape of the tick mark.
member.value: A value that determines the tick mark shape. Defaults to MarkerStyle.Trapezoid.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.CustomTickMark.Length
member.summary: Determines the length of the tick mark, measured in pixels.
member.value: A float that represents the tick mark length. Defaults to 5 pixels.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.CustomTickMark.Width
member.summary: Determines the width of the tick mark, measured in pixels.
member.value: A float that represents the tick mark width. Defaults to 3 pixels.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.CustomTickMark.Image
member.summary: The image to be used as a custom tick mark.
member.value: A string that represents either the pathname of an image saved to disk, or a named image, stored in the container's NamedImages collection.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.CustomTickMark.ImageTransColor
member.summary: The transparent color of the tick mark image.
member.value: A value that represents the color of the image that will be displayed as transparent.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.CustomTickMark.ImageHueColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the hue color to be applied to the tick mark image.
member.value: A that represents the hue color to be applied to the tick mark image. The default value is Color.Empty.
member.remarks: The hue color is applied to the entire image in order to modify its hue.

member.name: T:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.InputValueCollection
member.summary: Represents a collection of objects.
member.remarks:
This class is exposed as the property of the root object.
An InputValue represents an input value of the gauge container, and has an associated history that stores previous values along with a time stamp.
The advantage to using input values is that their historical data can be used for playback, as well as calculated values. They also provide a data binding mechanism.

member.name: T:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.CalculatedValueAverage
member.summary: This class represents an average calculated value.
member.remarks:
Average calculations have a period, which determines the range of data to be used for the calculation. The period is always measured from the present date/time, and goes back by the amount specified by the Period and PeriodType properties.
A calculated value is owned by an object, which has a collection.
Calculated values use the history of their input values as source data.

member.name: T:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.MapArea
member.summary: Represent a custom map area element, that has a user-defined shape and dimensions.
member.remarks:
MapArea objects are stored in the root container object's collection, and are used for custom map areas that have a user-defined shape and dimensions.
Note that client-side map areas are also created automatically by the control for gauge elements that have their Href or Tooltip properties set.
Setting this property will have no effect if the property is set to false.
The coordinates that must be specified for a custom map area depend on the shape of the map area:
Circle: Three coordinates must be provided: "x1,y1,r", where "x1,y2" are the coordinates of the center of the circle, and "r" is the radius of the circle.
Rectangle: Four coordinates must be provided: "x1,y1,x2,y2", where "x1,y1" are the coordinates of the upper-left corner of the rectangle and "x2,y2" are the coordinates of the lower-right corner of the rectangle.
Polygon: Two or more x and y pairs must be provided "x1,y1,x2,y2...xn,yn", where each "x,y" pair contains the coordinates of one vertex of the polygon.

member.name: M:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.MapArea.#ctor
member.summary: Public constructor.

member.returns: Map area HTML tag.

member.summary: Indicates that the map area is custom.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.MapArea.Coordinates
member.summary: Coordinates of the map area. The Shape determines how many coordinates are required to correctly draw the shape.
member.value:
An array of real numbers that determine the coordinates of the map area. The shape, determined by the property, determines the number of coordinates that are required.
The coordinates that must be specified for a custom map area depend on the shape of the map area:
Circle: Three coordinates must be provided: "x1,y1,r", where "x1,y2" are the coordinates of the center of the circle, and "r" is the radius of the circle.
Rectangle: Four coordinates must be provided: "x1,y1,x2,y2", where "x1,y1" are the coordinates of the upper-left corner of the rectangle and "x2,y2" are the coordinates of the lower-right corner of the rectangle.
Polygon: Two or more x and y pairs must be provided "x1,y1,x2,y2...xn,yn", where each "x,y" pair contains the coordinates of one vertex of the polygon.

member.remarks: Refer to the property for the type of coordinates that must be provided so that this shape is drawn correctly.

member.name: T:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.LinearLabelStyle
member.summary: This class represents the label style for linear gauges, and is applied to the scale labels of linear gauges.
member.remarks:
This class is applied to scale labels of LinearGauge objects.
Note that there are also objects, which can be displayed anywhere within the gauge container.

members.member: These members are equivalent to their corresponding members of the same name, with the exception that they return object. They are present in order to accommodate SmartClient interactivity through JavaScript in clients running the .NET Framework 2.0.

member.name: T:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.CircularLabelStyle
member.summary: This class represents the label style for circular gauges, and is applied to the scale labels of circular gauges.
member.remarks:
This class is applied to scale labels of CircularGauge objects.
Note that there are also objects, which can be displayed anywhere within the gauge container.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.CircularLabelStyle.AllowUpsideDown

member.name: T:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.LinearScale
member.summary: Scale for LinearGauge objects.
member.remarks:
Linear scales are stored in the property.
objects are assigned to a linear scale, and it is this scale the pointers 'points' to. objects are also assigned to scales.
The measurement-related properties of linear scales are measured as a percentage of the width or height of their parent (e.g. gauge container).

member.name: T:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.CalculatedValueMax
member.summary: This class represents a maximum calculated value.
member.remarks:
Maximum calculations have a period, which determines the range of data to be used for the calculation. The period is always measured from the present date/time, and goes back by the amount specified by the Period and PeriodType properties.
A calculated value is owned by an object, which has a collection.
Calculated values use the history of their input values as source data.

member.name: T:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.CalculatedValueMin
member.summary: This class represents an minimum calculated value.
member.remarks:
Minimum calculations have a period, which determines the range of data to be used for the calculation. The period is always measured from the present date/time, and goes back by the amount specified by the Period and PeriodType properties.
A calculated value is owned by an object, which has a collection.
Calculated values use the history of their input values as source data.

member.name: T:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.CalculatedValueCollection
member.summary: Implements a strongly typed collection of elements.
member.remarks:
CalculatedValueCollection provides an that is strongly typed for elements.
The CalculatedValue.Name property of the class can be used as a key to locate elements in the CalculatedValueCollection.
The collection cannot contain multiple identical keys. Access by key is an O(N) operation, where N is the current value of the CalculatedValueCollection.Count property.

member.summary: The distance from the tip of the pointer to the scale. Measured as a percent.

member.summary: The image to be used as a pointer.
member.value: A string that represents either the filename of an image saved to disk, or a named image added to the container's collection.

member.summary: Gets or sets the transparent color of the pointer image.
member.value: A that represents the transparent color of the image. The default value is Color.Empty.
member.remarks: If you have a pointer image with a yellow background and you would like to make the background transparent set this property to Color.Yellow.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.PointerBase.ImageHueColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the hue color to be applied to the pointer image.
member.value: A that represents the hue color to be applied to the pointer image. The default value is Color.Empty.
member.remarks: The hue color is applied to the entire image in order to modify its hue.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.PointerBase.ImageOrigin
member.summary: The point on the image that represents the pointer origin (in pixels).
member.value: A object, that represents the image origin.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.PointerBase.Value
member.summary: The current value of the pointer.
member.value: A double that represents the pointer's current value.
member.remarks:
This value determines where along a scale the pointer 'points' to.
Alternatively can be used to set the indicator's value.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.PointerBase.ValueSource
member.summary: Specifies the name of an input or calculated value.
member.value: A string that represents the pointer's input or calculated value.
member.remarks: If is used as the value source a history will be created, which is used for calculated values and playback.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.PointerBase.SnappingEnabled
member.summary: Determines if snapping of the pointer's value to a given interval is enabled.
member.value: If true the pointer will snap to values determined by the property, if false it will not. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.PointerBase.SnappingInterval
member.summary: The interval to use when snapping is enabled.
member.value: A double that represents the snapping interval. Defaults to 0.
member.remarks: If set to 0 there will be no snapping.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.PointerBase.DampeningEnabled
member.summary: Determines if the value movement will be dampened.
member.value: If true dampening is enabled, if false it is not. Defaults to false.

remarks.p: Dampening can be used if the value is being updated very quickly in order to slow down the movement of the pointer. This property is very useful for simulating an oil-filed gauge behavior.

p.b: ASP.NET - This property is only used when the Dundas Gauge for .NET is rendered as a Windows Forms control.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.PointerBase.DampeningSweepTime
member.summary: Represents the time it takes (in seconds) to make a full sweep from the minimum to the maximum of the scale.
member.value: An integer that represents the dampening sweep time. Defaults to 1 second.

remarks.b: ASP.NET - This property is only used when the Dundas Gauge for .NET is rendered as a Windows Forms control.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.PointerBase.ToolTip
member.summary: The tool tip to be displayed when the cursor is over the pointer.
member.remarks: The user can format the tool tip using #INPUTVALUE, #INPUTVALUE1, etc. The value from the GaugeContainer.Values collection will then be displayed. #POINTERVALUE can also be used to show the current value of the pointer.

member.remarks: Setting this prorpety will only have an effect if the MapEnabled property is set to true.

member.remarks: Setting this prorpety will only have an effect if the MapEnabled property is set to true.

member.value: If true the pointer will be interactive, if false it will not. Defaults to false.
member.remarks: This property is only used when the Dundas Gauge for .NET is rendered as a Windows Forms control.

member.summary: Determines the visibility of the pointer.
member.value: If true the pointer is visible, if false it is not. Defaults to true.

member.remarks: Setting this property will only have an effect if the pointer style is of type bar.

member.remarks:
This property represents the color of the border.
This property will not have any effect if the property is set to 0.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.PointerBase.BorderStyle
member.summary: The line style of the border.
member.value: A object that represents the color of the border. The default value is GaugeDashStyle.NotSet.
member.remarks:
This property represents the style of the border.

member.summary: The line width of the border, measured in pixels.

member.remarks: This property represents the width of the border.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.PointerBase.FillColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the fill color of the pointer.
member.value: A that represents the fill color. The default value is Color.White.
member.remarks: This property represents the fill color of the pointer. If a gradient is set via the property this color will be used as the start color for the gradient. Furthermore if a hatch style is set via the property this color will be used as the background color for the hatch.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.PointerBase.FillGradientEndColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the end color of the pointer's fill gradient.
member.value: A that represents the gradient end color. The default value is Color.Red.
member.remarks: This property represents the end color of the pointer's fill gradient. It is used if the property has a valid gradient. In addition to that it is also used as the hatch foreground color in case a hatch style is set via the property.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.PointerBase.FillHatchStyle
member.summary: The primary fill hatch style of the pointer.
member.value: A object that represents the hatch style. The default value is GaugeHatchStyle.None.
member.remarks: If hatching is specified then the and properties determine the colors used.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.PointerBase.FillGradientType
member.summary: The primary fill gradient type of the pointer.
member.value: A object that represents the gradient style. The default value is GradientType.DiagonalLeft.
member.remarks: If a gradient is specified then the and properties determine the colors used.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.PointerBase.MarkerStyle
member.summary: Determines the marker style if the pointer is of type marker.
member.value: A value that determines the bar style of the pointer.
member.remarks: Setting this property will only have an effect if the pointer style is of type marker.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.PointerBase.MarkerLength
member.summary: Determines the length of the marker if the pointer is of type marker.
member.value: A float value that determines the length of the marker.
member.remarks: Setting this property will only have an effect if the pointer style is of type marker.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.PointerBase.Width
member.summary: The width of the pointer, measured as a percentage.
member.value: A float that represents the pointer's width.
member.remarks: For a circular pointer width is measured as a percentage of the associated scale's radius. For a linear pointer, it is measured as a percentage of the linear gauge object's width.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.PointerBase.Cursor
member.summary: The cursor to be displayed when the mouse is over this pointer.

Use this property to set the cursor of this pointer. The cursor will change only when the mouse is over the pointer.
