member.value: If true dampening is enabled, if false it is not. Defaults to false.

remarks.p: Dampening can be used if the value is being updated very quickly in order to slow down the movement of the knob.

p.b: ASP.NET - This property is only used when the Dundas Gauge for .NET is rendered as a Windows Forms control.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.Knob.ToolTip
member.summary: The tool tip to be displayed when the cursor is over the knob.
member.remarks: The user can format the tool tip using #INPUTVALUE, #INPUTVALUE1, etc. The value from the GaugeContainer.Values collection will then be displayed. #POINTERVALUE can also be used to show the current value of the knob.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.Knob.Interactive
member.summary: Determines whether the user can move the knob with the mouse by clicking and dragging.
member.value: If true the knob will be interactive, if false it will not. Defaults to true.
member.remarks: This property is only used when the Dundas Gauge for .NET is rendered as a Windows Forms control.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.Knob.Visible
member.summary: Determines if the knob is visible.
member.value: If true the knob is visible, if false it is not. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.Knob.FillColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the fill color of the knob.
member.value: A that represents the fill color. The default value is Color.Gainsboro.
member.remarks: This property represents the fill color of the knob. If a gradient is set via the property this color will be used as the start color for the gradient. Furthermore if a hatch style is set via the property this color will be used as the background color for the hatch.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.Knob.FillGradientEndColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the end color of the knob's fill gradient.
member.value: A that represents the gradient end color. The default value is Color.Gray.
member.remarks: This property represents the end color of the knob's fill gradient. It is used if the property has a valid gradient. In addition to that it is also used as the hatch foreground color in case a hatch style is set via the property.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.Knob.FillHatchStyle
member.summary: The primary fill hatch style of the knob.
member.value: A object that represents the hatch style. The default value is GaugeHatchStyle.None.
member.remarks: If hatching is specified then the and properties determine the colors used.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.Knob.FillGradientType
member.summary: The primary fill gradient type of the knob.
member.value: A object that represents the gradient style. The default value is GradientType.DiagonalLeft.
member.remarks: If a gradient is specified then the and properties determine the colors used.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.Knob.CapVisible
member.summary: Determines if the cap in the center of the knob is visible.
member.value: true if the cap is visible, false if it is not. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.Knob.CapReflection
member.summary: Determines if the knob cap has a reflection effect.
member.value: true if the cap is reflection effect is on, false if it is off. Defaults to true.
member.remarks: Setting this property to true will cause the knob cap to appear like it is reflecting light internally. This effect is very useful for achieving a 3D gel look.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.Knob.CapWidth
member.summary: Determines the width of the knob cap, measured as a percentage of the knob width.
member.value: A float that represents the knob cap width. Defaults to 60 percent of the knob width

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.Knob.CapImage
member.summary: The image to be used for the knob cap.
member.value: String value that represents the path of the image to be used.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.Knob.CapImageTransColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the transparent color of the knob cap image.
member.value: A that represents the transparent color of the knob cap image. The default value is Color.Empty.
member.remarks: If you have a cap image with a yellow background and you would like to make the background transparent set this property to Color.Yellow.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.Knob.CapImageHueColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the hue color to be applied to the cap image.
member.value: A that represents the hue color to be applied to the cap image. The default value is Color.Empty.
member.remarks: The hue color is applied to the entire image in order to modify its hue.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.Knob.CapImageOrigin
member.summary: The point on the image that represents the knob origin (in pixels).
member.value: System.Drawing.Point value, that represents the knob origin.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.Knob.Width
member.summary: The width of the knob, measured as a percentage of the associated scale diameter.
member.value: A float, which represents the knob width.

member.summary: Determines the marker style if this knob is of type marker.
member.value: A enumeration value.
member.remarks: Setting this property will only have an effect if the knob type is marker.

member.summary: Determines the style of the knob.

member.summary: Gets or sets the fill color of the knob cap.
member.value: A that represents the knob cap fill color. The default value is Color.Gainsboro.
member.remarks:
This property represents the cap fill color of the knob.
If a gradient is selected through the property this color will be used as the start color for the gradient.
If a hatch style is selected through the property this color will be used as the background color for the hatch.

member.summary: The fill gradient type of the knob cap.

member.summary: Gets or sets the end color of the knob's cap fill gradient.
member.value: A that represents the gradient end color. The default value is Color.Gray.
member.remarks:
This property represents the end color of the knob's cap fill gradient. It is used if the property has a valid gradient.

member.summary: Determines if the gradient of the knob should rotate or remain static.
member.value: A bool that indicated if the knob gradient should rotate. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.Knob.CapRotateGradient
member.summary: Determines if the gradient of the cap should rotate or remain static.
member.value: A bool that indicated if the cap gradient should rotate. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Set this property to true if you want the gradient of the cap to rotate along with the knob itself. This property will not have an effect if the CapGradientType property is set to None.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.Knob.MarkerRotateGradient
member.summary: Determines if the gradient of the marker should rotate or remain static.
member.value: A bool that indicated if the marker gradient should rotate. The default value is true.
member.remarks: Set this property to true if you want the gradient of the marker to rotate along with the knob itself. This property will not have an effect if the property is set to .

This property is only used when the Dundas Gauge for .NET is rendered as a Windows Forms control.

member.name: T:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.CalculatedValueRateOfChange
member.summary: This class represents a rate of change calculated value.
member.remarks:
Rate of change calculations have a rate-of-change period, which determines the amount of time that elapses for the change to occur (e.g. per second, per 10 years, etc.).
A calculated value is owned by an object, which has a collection.
Calculated values use the history of their input values as source data.

member.name: T:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.GaugeSerializer
member.summary: Gauge serializer class, used for serialization of gauge templates.
member.remarks:
This class is exposed as the property of the root object.
There are LoadTemplate and SaveTemplate dialogs that can be accessed at design-time via the Properties Window.
The format of serialized data is set by the property, and can be either XML or Binary. The advantage of XML is that it is human readable, while the advantage of binary is that the serialized data takes less storage space compared to the XML format.
Serialization of the Gauge is performed at run-time using the and methods. By default all gauge properties are serialized. However, this can be changed using the , and properties.
groups the gauge properties to be serialized into categories (e.g. data, appearance, etc.)It is important to know that the Content property is implemented internally by the control as the SerializableContent property.
The property is a comma-separated listing of all gauge properties to be serialized. The syntax of this property is "Class.Property[,Class.Property]", and wildcards may be used (represented by an asterisk). For example, to serialize all gauge BackColor properties set this property to "*.BackColor". Once this property is set to an explicit value then it is up to the developer to specify all properties to be saved .
The Content and SerializableContent properties can also be used in conjunction. However, make sure that SerializableContent is concatenated with itself when being set after setting the Content property (Content is implemented internally using SerializableContent with wildcards), otherwise the gauge properties specified by the Content property will be overridden.
Non-serializable properties are set using the property. Wildcards can be used in the string expression, in the same manner as the SerializableContent property. For example, to exclude all gauge BackColor properties from serialization set this property to "*.BackColor".
Sometimes a property can be set to be both serialized and not serialized (common when wildcards are used). Note that NonSerializableContent has a lower priority when compared to the SerializableContent string expression. However, less weight is given to string expressions that use wildcards. For example, if SerializableContent is set to "*.BackColor" and NonSerializableContent is set to "CircularGauge.BackColor" then all BackColor properties except for CircularGauge objects will be serialized.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.GaugeSerializer.Content
member.summary: The serializable content, assigned by category.
member.value: A value, which represents the serializable content.

remarks.p: Serialization of the Gauge is performed at run-time using the and methods. By default all gauge properties are serialized. However, this can be changed using the , and properties.

groups the gauge properties to be serialized into categories (e.g. data, appearance, etc.)It is important to know that the Content property is implemented internally by the control as the SerializableContent property.

The property is a comma-separated listing of all gauge properties to be serialized. The syntax of this property is "Class.Property[,Class.Property]", and wildcards may be used (represented by an asterisk). For example, to serialize all gauge BackColor properties set this property to "*.BackColor". Once this property is set to an explicit value then it is up to the developer to specify all properties to be saved .

The Content and SerializableContent properties can also be used in conjunction. However, make sure that SerializableContent is concatenated with itself when being set after setting the Content property (Content is implemented internally using SerializableContent with wildcards), otherwise the gauge properties specified by the Content property will be overridden.

Non-serializable properties are set using the property. Wildcards can be used in the string expression, in the same manner as the SerializableContent property. For example, to exclude all gauge BackColor properties from serialization set this property to "*.BackColor".

Sometimes a property can be set to be both serialized and not serialized (common when wildcards are used). Note that NonSerializableContent has a lower priority when compared to the SerializableContent string expression. However, less weight is given to string expressions that use wildcards. For example, if SerializableContent is set to "*.BackColor" and NonSerializableContent is set to "CircularGauge.BackColor" then all BackColor properties except for CircularGauge objects will be serialized.

member.summary: Format used to serialize the gauge data.

member.summary: Determines if object properties are reset to their default values prior to loading.
member.value: If true properties are reset, if false they are not. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.GaugeSerializer.IgnoreUnknownXmlAttributes
member.summary: Determines if unknown XML attributes and elements will be ignored (no exception will be thrown).
member.value: If true unknown attributes will be ignored, if false an exception will be thrown if they are encountered during serialization. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.GaugeSerializer.TemplateMode
member.summary: Determines if the serializer works in template mode, which determines if items are added to or removed from the container's various collections when a template is loaded.
member.value: If true the serializer will be in template creation mode, if false it will not. Defaults to false.
member.remarks:
If the serializer is in template mode then the various existing gauge objects are not actually loaded into the gauge container when the method is called. Rather, the appearance properties, position properties, etc. only are used.
To further clarify this, when TemplateMode is true and a template (that has been saved using the method) is loaded into the container the container's collections (e.g. CircularGauges, NumericIndicators, etc.) are not modified. In other words, they do not have objects added or removed as a result of what the template's contents are.
If TemplateMode is false then the number of container child objects (such as gauges and indicators), is determined by the contents of the persisted template when it is loaded.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.BackFrame.Style
member.summary: NOTE: This property is obsolete in Dundas Gauge 2.0. FrameStyle is supposed to be used instead. Gets or sets the style of the frame.
member.value: A value. The default is BackFrameStyle.None if the frame belongs to or BackFrameStyle.Edged if the frame belongs to a or object.
member.remarks: This property determines which pre-defined frame style should be used to render the frame.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.BackFrame.FrameStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the style of the frame.
member.value: A value. The default is BackFrameStyle.None if the frame belongs to or BackFrameStyle.Edged if the frame belongs to a or object.
member.remarks: This property determines which pre-defined frame style should be used to render the frame.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.BackFrame.Shape
member.summary:
NOTE: This property is obsolete in Dundas Gauge 2.0. FrameShape is supposed to be used instead. Gets or sets the style of the frame.
Gets or sets the overall frame shape, which can be circular or rectangular.
member.value: A value. The default is BackFrameShape.Circular if the frame belongs to a or BackFrameStyle.Rectangular if the frame belongs to a object.
member.remarks: This property determines if the frame is circular or rectangular. Note that circular frames will never appear elliptical.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.BackFrame.FrameShape
member.summary: Gets or sets the overall frame shape, which can be circular or rectangular.
member.value: A value. The default is BackFrameShape.Circular if the frame belongs to a or BackFrameStyle.Rectangular if the frame belongs to a object.
member.remarks: This property determines if the frame is circular or rectangular. Note that circular frames will never appear elliptical.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.BackFrame.FrameWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the frame. Measured as a percentage of width/height.
member.value: A float that represents the width of the frame. The default value is 8 percent.
member.remarks: This property represents the width (thickness) of the frame. It is measured as a percentage of the width or height of the gauge or gauge container, whichever is smaller. For example, if the gauge container is 400 pixels wide and 200 pixels high and the frame width is set to 10 then it will be 10 percent of 200 pixels, which is 10 pixels.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.BackFrame.FrameColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the frame, but not the color of its background.
member.value: A that represents the color of the frame. The default value is Color.Gainsboro.
member.remarks: This property represents the color of the frame, but not the color of its background. If you would like to modify the color of the frame's background please use the property.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.BackFrame.FrameGradientType
member.summary: The gradient type of the frame.
member.value: A value, that represents the gradient type. Defaults to GradientType.DiagonalLeft.
member.remarks: If this property is set to a valid gradient type then the colors used are determined by the and properties.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.BackFrame.FrameGradientEndColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the end color of the frame gradient.
member.value: A that represents the end color of the frame gradient. The default value is Color.Gray.
member.remarks: This property represents end color of the frame gradient. It is used if the property has a valid gradient. In addition to that it is also used as the hatch foreground color in case a hatch style is set via the property.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.BackFrame.FrameHatchStyle
member.summary: The hatch style of the frame.
member.value: A value, representing the hatch style. Defaults to GaugeHatchStyle.None.
member.remarks: If hatching is specified then the and properties determine the colors used.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.BackFrame.Image
member.summary: The image to be used as a frame.
member.value: A string that represents either the pathname of an image saved to disk, or the name of a named image stored in the collection.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.BackFrame.ImageTransColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the transparent color of the frame image.
member.value: A that represents the transparent color of the frame image. The default value is Color.Empty.
member.remarks: If you have a frame image with a yellow background and you would like to make the background transparent set this property to Color.Yellow.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.BackFrame.ImageHueColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the hue color to be applied to the image.
member.value: A that represents the hue color to be applied to the frame image. The default value is Color.Empty.
member.remarks: The hue color is applied to the entire image in order to modify its hue.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.BackFrame.BorderColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the frame's border.
member.value: A that represents the color of the frame border. The default value is Color.Black.
member.remarks: This property will not have any effect if the property is set to 0.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.BackFrame.BorderStyle
member.summary: The line style of the frame's border.
member.value: A object that represents the style of the frame border. The default value is GaugeDashStyle.Solid.
member.remarks: This property will not have any effect if the property is set to 0.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.BackFrame.BorderWidth
member.summary: The line width of the back frame's border. Measured in pixels.
member.value: An integer that represents the line width. Defaults to 0 pixels.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.BackFrame.BackColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the frame's background.
member.value: A that represents the color of the frame's background. The default value is Color.Silver.
member.remarks: This property represents the color of the frame background, but not the color of the actual frame. If you would like to modify the color of the actual frame please use the property.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.BackFrame.BackGradientType
member.summary: The gradient type of the back.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.BackFrame.BackGradientEndColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the end color of the frame's back gradient.
member.value: A that represents the end color of the frame's back gradient. The default value is Color.Gray.
member.remarks: This property represents end color of the frame's back gradient. It is used if the property has a valid gradient. In addition to that it is also used as the hatch foreground color in case a hatch style is selected through the property.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.LinearPointer.FillGradientType
member.summary: The primary fill gradient type of the pointer.
member.value: A enumeration value.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.LinearPointer.ThermometerBulbOffset
member.summary: Determines the offset of the thermometer bulb from the zero position.
member.value: A float that represents the bulb offset. The default value is 5.
member.remarks: This property is used only when the property is set to .

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.LinearPointer.ThermometerBulbSize
member.summary: Determines the size of the thermometer bulb.
member.value: A float that represents the bulb offset. The default value is 50.
member.remarks: This property is used only when the property is set to .

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.LinearPointer.ThermometerBackColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the thermometer's back color.
member.value: A Color that represents the thermometer's back color. The default value is Color.Empty.
member.remarks:
This property represents the thermometer's back color.
If a gradient is selected through the property this color will be used as the start color for the gradient.
If a hatch style is selected through the property this color will be used as the background color for the hatch.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.LinearPointer.ThermometerBackGradientType
member.summary: The thermometer back gradient type.
member.value: A enumeration value.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.LinearPointer.ThermometerBackGradientEndColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the end color of the thermometer's back gradient.
member.value: A that represents the gradient end color. The default value is Color.Empty.
member.remarks:
This property represents the end color of the thermometer's back gradient. It is used if the property has a valid gradient.
In addition to that it is also used as the hatch foreground color in case a back hatch style is selected via the property.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.LinearPointer.ThermometerBackHatchStyle
member.summary: The hatch style of the thermometer's back.
member.value: A enumeration value.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.LinearPointer.ThermometerStyle
member.summary: Determines the style of the thermometer.
member.value: A value that determines the thermometer style of the pointer. Defaults to ThermometerStyle.Standard.
member.remarks: Setting this property will only have an effect if the pointer type is thermometer.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.LinearPointer.Cursor
member.summary: The cursor to be displayed when the mouse is over this pointer.
member.value: A reference to which represents the cursor. The default value is System.Windows.Forms.Cursors.Default.
member.remarks:
Use this property to set the cursor of this pointer. The cursor will change only when the mouse is over the pointer.
Note: When this property is set to the cursor specified in the property will be used.
This property is only used when the Dundas Gauge for .NET is rendered as a Windows Forms control.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.LinearPointer.DampeningEnabled
member.summary: Determines if the movement of the pointer will be dampened.
member.value: If true dampening is enabled, if false it is not. Defaults to false.

remarks.p: Dampening can be used if the value is being updated very quickly in order to slow down the movement of the pointer.

p.b: ASP.NET - This property is only used when the Dundas Gauge for .NET is rendered as a Windows Forms control.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.LinearPointer.Selected
member.summary: Determines if the pointer visually appears selected.
member.value: If true the pointer appears selected. Default value is false.

member.name: T:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.State
member.summary: Represents the state of a StateIndicator object.
member.remarks:
State indicators can have one or more defined states, which are either on or off.
States are stored in a , which is exposed via the property.

member.name: M:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.State.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes new instance of State class

member.name: M:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.State.ToString
member.summary: Gets the name of the state.
member.returns: String that represents the name of the string.

member.name: M:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.State.OnAdded
member.summary: This method is called right after this NamedElement becomes a member of a NamedCollection.

member.name: M:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.State.OnValueRangeTimeOut(System.Object,Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.ValueRangeEventArgs)
member.summary: Overrides OnValueRangeTimeOut of Range in order to refresh parent state indicator,

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.State.Name
member.summary: The name of the state.
member.value: A string that represents the state's name.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.State.StartValue
member.summary: The start and end values determine when the state is activated.
member.value: A double that represents the start value. Defaults to 70.
member.remarks: If the value of a state indicator falls within the start and end values of one of its states then that state is activated.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.State.EndValue
member.summary: The start and end values determine when the state is activated.
member.value: A double that represents the end value. Defaults to 100.
member.remarks: If the value of a state indicator falls within the start and end values of one of its states then that state is activated.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.State.TriggerDelay
member.summary: Determines how long the state indicator value needs to be in range before this state is activated.
member.value: A double that represents the trigger delay. Defaults to 0, of the type determined by the property.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.State.TriggerDelayType
member.summary: The type of the TriggerDelay value.
member.value: A PeriodType value that represents the trigger delay type. Defaults to PeriodType.Seconds.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.State.Font
member.summary: Specifies the font of the state.
member.value: A object, which represents the state's font.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.State.BorderColor
member.summary: The color of the state indicator's border when this state is activated.
member.value: A object that represents the border color. Defaults to Color.Black.
member.remarks: Setting this property will only have an effect if the border width is set to a value greater than 0.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.State.BorderStyle
member.summary: The line style of the state indicator's border when this state is activated.
member.value: A value that represents the border style. Defaults to GaugeDashStyle.Solid.
member.remarks: Setting this property will only have an effect if the border width is set to a value greater than 0.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.State.BorderWidth
member.summary: The width of the state indicator's border when this state is activated. Measured in pixels.
member.value: An integer that represents the width. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.State.FillColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the fill color of the state indicator when this state is activated.
member.value: A that represents the fill color. The default value is Color.Red.
member.remarks: This property represents the fill color of the state indicator when this state is activated. If a gradient is set via the property this color will be used as the start color for the gradient. Furthermore if a hatch style is set via the property this color will be used as the background color for the hatch.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.State.FillGradientType
member.summary: The primary fill gradient type of the state indicator when this state is activated.
member.value: A object that represents the gradient style. The default value is GradientType.Center.
member.remarks: If a gradient is specified then the and properties determine the colors used.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.State.FillGradientEndColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the end color of the state indicator when this state is activated.
member.value: A that represents the gradient end color. The default value is Color.DarkRed.
member.remarks: This property represents the end color of the fill gradient. It is used if the property has a valid gradient. In addition to that it is also used as the hatch foreground color in case a hatch style is set via the property.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.State.FillHatchStyle
member.summary: The primary fill hatch style of the state indicator when this state is activated.
member.value: A object that represents the hatch style. The default value is GaugeHatchStyle.None.
member.remarks: If hatching is specified then the and properties determine the colors used.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.State.Text
member.summary: The text to be displayed when this state is activated.
member.value: A string that represents the state indicator's text when this state is activated.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.State.Image
member.summary: The image to be used for this state.
member.value: A string that represents the pathname of an image saved to disk, or the name of a named image stored in the collection property.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.State.ImageTransColor
member.summary: The transparent color of the state image.
member.value: A object that represents the color that will be displayed as transparent. Defaults to Color.Empty.

member.name: P:Dundas.Gauges.WebControl.State.ImageHueColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the hue color to be applied to the state image.
member.value: A that represents the hue color to be applied to the state image. The default value is Color.Empty.
member.remarks: The hue color is applied to the entire image in order to modify its hue.

member.summary: This is design time type converter of the State class

member.summary: Initialize new instance of this Converter class
